sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"价格，费用"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: charge, price, fee, fare, cost, expense
means: charge ： 指提供服务时索取的费用，也指货物的价格、价钱。
price ： 指商品在市场出售的价格，尤指卖方对商品所提出的单价。比喻意义指付出的代价。
fee ： 指上学、求医以及找律师等付的费用，还可指会费、借书费等。
fare ： 侧重指旅行时所付的车、船费等费用。
cost ： 指生产某东西的成本，也泛指商品的价格，可与price换用。
expense ： 常指实际支付的费用总数额，有时也指钱的花费。

sentence.Network_en: Owen was against it, on the grounds of expense.
sentence.Network_cn: 欧文因费用问题对此表示反对。

sentence.Network_en: I'll try to save him the expense of a flight from Perth.
sentence.Network_cn: 我会设法替他省下要从珀斯飞来的机票费用。

sentence.Network_en: He put Elizabeth's motel bill and airfare on his expense account.
sentence.Network_cn: 他将伊丽莎白住汽车旅馆的费用和机票费用记在他的报销账目中。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 由某人付费；由某人承担费用

lj.lj_ly: the document was printed at the taxpayer's expense.
lj.lj_ls: 文件的印刷费用由纳税人承担。

jx.jx_en_mean: so as to cause harm to or neglect of

lj.lj_ly: the pursuit of profit at the expense of the environment.
lj.lj_ls: 以环境为代价的利润追求。

lj.lj_ly: language courses which emphasize communication skills at the expense of literature.
lj.lj_ls: 强调交际技能而忽视文学的语言课程。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Anglo-Norman French, alteration of Old French espense, from late Latin expensa (pecunia) '(money) spent', from Latin expendere 'pay out' (see expend)

entry.def: Expense is the money that something costs you or that you need to spend in order to do something.

example.ex: He's bought a specially big TV at vast expense so that everyone can see properly...
example.tran: 他花大价钱买了一台特别大的电视机，这样每个人都能看清楚。

example.ex: To avoid extra expense and mess later on, try to decide on fittings before the plastering's finished...
example.tran: 为避免将来出现额外的开支和不必要的麻烦，尽量在抹灰完工之前把固定设施确定下来。

entry.tran: （由雇主报销的）开支，费用，业务费用
entry.def: Expenses are amounts of money that you spend while doing something in the course of your work, which will be paid back to you afterwards.

example.ex: As a member of the International Olympic Committee her fares and hotel expenses were paid by the IOC...
example.tran: 作为国际奥林匹克委员会的成员，她的交通费用和酒店住宿费用都由国际奥委会支付。

example.ex: Can you claim this back on expenses?

entry.def: If you do something at someone's expense, they provide the money for it.

example.ex: Should architects continue to be trained for five years at public expense?...
example.tran: 建筑师是否应该继续接受5年的公费培训呢？

example.ex: Teachers who signed up did so out of personal choice and at their own expense.
example.tran: 报名的教师完全出于自愿而且费用自理。

entry.tran: 拿…开玩笑;以…为嘲弄的对象
entry.def: If someone laughs or makes a joke at your expense, they do it to make you seem foolish.

example.ex: I think he's having fun at our expense.
example.tran: 我想他在拿我们寻开心。

entry.def: If you achieve something at the expense of someone, you do it in a way which might cause them some harm or disadvantage.

example.ex: But skeptics worry that costs may be trimmed at the expense of the patient...
example.tran: 但是持怀疑态度的人担心费用的削减会以牺牲病人的利益为代价。

example.ex: According to this study, women have made notable gains at the expense of men.
example.tran: 根据这项研究，女性以牺牲男性的利益为代价而获得了显著的收益。

entry.def: If you say that someone does something at the expense of another thing, you are expressing concern at the fact that they are not doing the second thing, because the first thing uses all their resources.

example.ex: They are worth having but not at the expense of better services...
example.tran: 它们值得拥有，但是不能因此放弃更好的服务。

example.ex: The orchestra has more discipline now, but at the expense of spirit.
example.tran: 那个管弦乐团现在更有纪律性了，却丧失了灵魂。

entry.def: If you go to the expense of doing something, you do something which costs a lot of money. If you go to great expense to do something, you spend a lot of money in order to achieve it.

example.ex: Why go to the expense of buying an electric saw when you can hire one?...
example.tran: 既然可以租电锯，为什么要花大价钱买一个呢？

example.ex: It was said that he went to great expense to install a lift in the building.
example.tran: 据说他花费巨资在大楼里安装了一台电梯。

means.word_mean: 1. amounts paid for goods and services that may be currently tax deductible (as opposed to capital expenditures)
3. money spent to perform work and usually reimbursed by an employer;

sentences.sentence: "he kept a careful record of his expenses at the meeting"

auth_sentence.content: Buganda begins to expand at the expense of Bunyoro.
auth_sentence.res_content: Buganda begins to expand at the expense of Bunyoro.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Buganda begins to expand at the expense of Bunyoro.

auth_sentence.content: "The expense and anxiety of children" indeed.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "The expense and anxiety of children" indeed.

auth_sentence.content: The real expense resides in our reluctance to change.
auth_sentence.res_content: The real expense resides in our reluctance to change.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The real expense resides in our reluctance to change.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. =expend,表示"花费,支付"; 2. 最初意思为"称重量而衡量……",引申出花费,支付; 3. =hang,表示"悬挂"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 可分配的,不是必要的,可有可无的
stems_affixes.word_buile: dispense分配+able可以……的→dispensable可分配的→能分送出去的,不重要的
ex出+pens花费,支付+ive……的→要花很多钱出去的
dispense分配+ary场地→dispensary分配[药]的地方→药房

stems_affixes.value_cn: 费用, 代价, 损失

stems_affixes.word_buile: pens花费,支付+ion表名词→用以花费,支付的
pro多+pens花费,支付+ity性质,特性→某[方面]花费的多→嗜好
suspense[v.担心;悬而不决]+ion表名词→n.悬挂,暂停,停职;悬[置]架
com全部+pens支付+ate表动词→为……而全部支付→赔偿
dis分开+pens花费+e→分开花费→分配[财富等]

Sentence.sentence: They want to cut down their utility expenses.
To try to cut down its operational expenses.
People do it at the expense of everything that was a constant in their lives.
What does the woman suggest they do instead of paying the South Theater Company's travel expenses?
They argue that when a company like Monsanto goes to great expense to create a valuable new genetically modified seed, it must be able to protect its property interests

jushi.english: I can't afford the expense of redecorating my house.
jushi.chinese: 我负担不起重新装修房子的费用。

jushi.english: House repairs, holidays and other expenses reduced his bank balance to almost nothing.
jushi.chinese: 修房、度假和其他开销使他在银行的存款所剩无几。

jushi.english: It's too much of an expense to own a car.
jushi.chinese: 拥有一辆汽车的花费太大。
